result.execSummary:
All charges against Wayne Cordell Cooper in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Wayne Cordell Cooper is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wayne Cordell Cooper

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wayne Cordell Cooper in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Wayne Cordell Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case is set for Jury Trial. Defense ready to proceed. State's essential witness failed to appear. State has no alternative theory of prosecution. Defense motion to Dismiss is GRANTED by the Court.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Wayne Cordell Cooper in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wayne Cordell Cooper appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for final pre-trial. Final pretrial conference held.  Parties remain in trial posture. Jury trial remains scheduled on 8-29-2022 in Branch 30.
States Witness List, received and filed.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed

Defendant Wayne Cordell Cooper in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wayne Cordell Cooper appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Wayne Cordell Cooper in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wayne Cordell Cooper appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has  received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture.  Case adjourned to Branch 30. Status conference is scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with TPH
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Wayne Cordell Cooper in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Wayne Cordell Cooper in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
